summary: The DHS Biodetection Improvement Act aims to enhance the Department of Homeland Security's (DHS) biodetection capabilities. It mandates an assessment of DHS's current use of Department of Energy (DOE) national labs for biodetection R&D, and directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to develop a strategy for future collaborations. This strategy must address biodetection technology identification, acquisition plans, external evaluations, and partnerships with various entities to define program requirements. Reports to Congress are required on the assessment and strategy implementation.
